There are a couple of thoughts that might be useful: "What you think of me is none of my business" This has to do with recognizing out own innate self worth, and therefore not making others responsible for how we feel about ourselves. Second, the light of joy dwells within us, and as we reside within this joy, we radiate it out to the world, and as we are radiating joy which is an eternal font of expression, our life expression in the world is joyous. Where attention goes, Energy flows. At the center of a vortex, there is stillness while at the same time, there is a flow surrounding it. As we move away from the stillness, the flow seems to become more turbulent and chaotic, so that we are buffeted about in our life expressing. Returning to the stillness within, via meditation, brings us to a place where we recognize the external flow springs from the stillness so that we may always return to the center of our being where stillness is ever present.

I've share this before via other venues, a saying which came to me years ago: "The joy of life is to be found in each moment lived. NOW is the moment." Joy, as well as the stillness resides in the HERE NOW moment by moment unfolding. It is ever present, and as we are present within IT, we contribute to the joyous expression of life in life.
Blessings to us all!

Being on this spiritual journey of mine, Iâ€™ve realised how important it is to re-define our own idea of â€˜successâ€™, and not just accept what society tells us. Success is nothing more than a successful present moment, because in presence we feel connected and loved with ourselves and everything around us.

@TheAwakenedINFJ while we're human, it's actually important to have the ego intact, the ego is what protects us, helps us discern at times, and it can keep us out of unnecessary trouble. What isn't healthy is an OVER-active ego. What I've found works best is finding humor in your own ego, thanking it for helping you, but also asking it to take a step aside rather than right out ignoring it and trying to demolish it. âœŒï¸ I know you probably know all of this, my ego wanted to be tickled in this moment to share this info ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜¬
@TheAwakenedINFJ Mirror neuron, copying the other persons movements to seem more sympathetic. It's hardwired into our and other primates brains.
Social conditioning, reacting subconsciously to one's environment. Always a clear cut case of ego being active.

Is it ironic that extensive use and engagement with social media, although very social, can alter our feelings of isolation and depression.  Fear of missing out, depression when comparing your lives to the flamboyant lifestyles of others, narcissistic egocentrism.  All of which  was heavily influencing my life until I gave up my personal social media accounts in 2016 since the birth of my first son. Was using since Facebook and YouTube inception.  Now my life couldn't be better!  Just have to stop getting too deep into the news sites and live a bit more and it will be like the pre, 2008 days of Nokia cell phones and generally a better time out with friends and family in my opinion.  Just my opinion.
